intro: Neoporteria odieri var. krausii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in winter, adding ornamental value to gardens. Its leaves are typically narrow and leathery, with a fragrant aroma when crushed. It is well-suited for coastal gardens due to its tolerance of salty air and well-drained soils.
